paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: late-onset cardiomyopathy indistinguishable from senile cardiac amyloidosis

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In a large autopsy study that included individuals with cardiac amyloidosis, the TTR Val122Ile allele was present in 3.9% of all African Americans and 23% of African Americans with cardiac amyloidosis.
Penetrance of the mutation is not truly known and is associated with a late-onset cardiomyopathy that is indistinguishable from senile cardiac amyloidosis.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation is associated with late-onset cardiomyopathy.

variants.population_frequency: 3.9% in African Americans, 23% in African Americans with cardiac amyloidosis
variants.additional_notes: Neuropathy is not generally a feature of this ATTR due to Val122Ile.
key_quotes: Penetrance of the mutation is not truly known and is associated with a late-onset cardiomyopathy that is indistinguishable from senile cardiac amyloidosis.
The TTR Val122Ile allele was present in 3.9% of all African Americans and 23% of African Americans with cardiac amyloidosis.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: For example, cardiac involvement is rare in variant ATTR associated with Val30Met.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is associated with rare cardiac involvement.

variants.additional_notes: Cardiac involvement is rare in variant ATTR associated with Val30Met.
key_quotes: Cardiac involvement is rare in variant ATTR associated with Val30Met.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of Pathology, Presentation, and Management of Different Amyloid Types
